## PLOTTING

Create a bar graph, where vertical axis is number of days in each month, horizontal axis is months, and the bars are stacked for number of days with good, medium and bad air quality for each sensor.

```{r}
# Convert the 'date' column to a proper datetime object
mod_met$date <- ymd_hms(mod_met$date)

# Extract the date part from the datetime strings
mod_met$day <- as.Date(mod_met$date)

# Group by date and sensor, calculate daily averages, and keep one row per day per sensor
modmet_daily <- mod_met %>%
  group_by(day, sn) %>%
  summarize(
    pm1_avg = mean(pm1),
    pm25_avg = mean(pm25),
    pm10_avg = mean(pm10),
    .groups = "drop"
  ) %>%
  group_by(day) %>%
  slice(1)  # Keep only one row per day

print(modmet_daily)
```

```{r}
# Categorize the days based on pm1_avg values into "Good," "Medium," and "Bad"
modmet_daily <- modmet_daily %>%
  mutate(pm1_category = case_when(
    pm1_avg < 1 ~ "Good",
    pm1_avg >= 1 & pm1_avg < 6 ~ "Medium",
    pm1_avg >= 6 ~ "Bad",
    TRUE ~ NA_character_
  ))

# Set the order of levels for the "pm1_category" variable
modmet_daily$pm1_category <- factor(modmet_daily$pm1_category, levels = c("Bad", "Medium", "Good"))

# Extract the month from the 'day' column
modmet_daily$month <- month(modmet_daily$day, label = TRUE)

# Iterate over each unique sensor (sn) value
unique_sensors <- unique(modmet_daily$sn)

for (sensor in unique_sensors) {
  # Filter data for the current sensor
  data_for_sensor <- modmet_daily %>% filter(sn == sensor)
  
  # Calculate the count of each category per month
  data_for_sensor_counts <- data_for_sensor %>%
    group_by(month, pm1_category) %>%
    tally(name = "count")
  
  # Create a stacked bar graph
  p <- ggplot(data_for_sensor_counts, aes(x = month, y = count, fill = pm1_category)) +
    geom_bar(stat = "identity", width=0.5) +
    ylim(0, 30) +
    labs(x = "Month", y = "Number of Days", title = paste("Air Quality Summary for Sensor", sensor)) +
    # Adjust the colors in the 'scale_fill_manual()' function to match the new order
    scale_fill_manual(values = c("Bad" = "red", "Medium" = "orange", "Good" = "green")) +
    theme_minimal()
  
  # Save the plot as a JPG file
  jpg_filename <- paste("../figures/aq_ratings/aq-", sensor, ".jpg", sep = "")
  ggsave(filename = jpg_filename, plot = p, width = 10, height = 6)
}
```
